poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Whales hum. Something - not the gannet - Wails. The moon wanes, good. The weans are asleep, wames tight knotted On their grub. Wagonloads of wares Reduced she wears next to the skin, not safe. Wades in. The waves disperse her Gravity. She weighs not less but any- ways that's her on board.
